column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Softbank closer to acquiring Sprint after Dish abandons bid for now
column5: (Corrects paragraph 15 to state SoftBank would be happy with a Sprint majority stake in Clearwire  not minority stake)

column4: Sun Life says regulatory hurdles delay sale of U.S. annuity unit
column5: TORONTO Sun Life Financial Inc  on Friday warned of a likely delay in the sale of its U.S. annuity business because the New York Department of Financial Services has yet to approve the deal.

column4: EXCLUSIVE-Blackstone interviewing banks for Brixmor IPO -sources
column5: June 21 Blackstone Group LP is interviewing investment bankers for a proposed initial public offering of its neighborhood shopping center company  Brixmor Property Group Inc  according to two people familiar with the process.

column4: Blackstone  Temasek eye stake in India's Shriram Ventures - sources
column5: MUMBAI U.S. private equity firm Blackstone Group LP  and Singapore state investor Temasek Holdings  are in separate talks to invest about $200 million in India's Shriram Ventures  the non-financial services arm of Shriram Group  three sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

column4: Exclusive: FINRA beefs up policing of arbitrators
column5: Wall Street's industry-funded watchdog said it was beefing up oversight of its 6 500 securities arbitrators after one of them was criminally indicted and suspended from the practice of law but failed to properly disclose those legal run-ins.

column4: Warner Bros film chief Robinov asks to negotiate exit: report
column5: Warner Bros Pictures Group President Jeff Robinov asked to negotiate his exit from the Time Warner Inc-owned film studio he has led since 2007  Hollywood news website Deadline.com reported on Friday.

column4: Gandolfini gone  'Sopranos' may get only brief bump
column5: A spike in sales of "The Sopranos" DVDs  downloads and merchandise based on the mafia series following star James Gandolfini's death may only be short-lived and likely won't provide much of a windfall for HBO and its parent Time Warner Inc.

column4: South Korea rejects preliminary casino licenses for Caesars  Universal
column5: SEOUL/HONG KONG South Korea has rejected preliminary casino licenses for two international bidders - a Caesars Entertainment Corp and Lippo Limited consortium  and Kazuo Okada's Universal Entertainment Corp - in a surprise move that could stall the government's casino development plans.

column4: Gunman shoots 4 outside North Carolina law firm  Walmart
column5: WINSTON-SALEM  North Carolina A man armed with a shotgun and a bag of ammunition opened fire outside a law firm and a Walmart store in Greenville  North Carolina  on Friday  shooting four people before police shot him  the city's police chief said.
